title: 17-year-old stabbed inside Roxbury high school, no arrests, police say
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A 17-year-old was stabbed inside Madison Park High School on Malcolm X Boulevard in Roxbury, Boston police report.
The student sustained a minor stab wound and was taken to a hospital; the suspect fled and remains at large.
Both Madison Park and John D. O'Bryant schools were briefly placed in safe mode; Boston Public Schools activated a crisis response team.

title: Report: Ex-Patriots QB Mac Jones is ‘in line’ to start for 49ers on Sunday
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Mac Jones is expected to start for the 49ers on Sunday as Brock Purdy deals with a shoulder and toe injury.
Brock Purdy, San Francisco's starter, could be out for multiple weeks, according to head coach Kyle Shanahan.
Jones, formerly with the Patriots and Jaguars, signed a two-year, $8.1 million deal with the 49ers in the offseason.

title: Conservative activist Charlie Kirk dies after being shot at Utah college event, Trump says
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Charlie Kirk, a conservative activist, was shot and killed at Utah Valley University during an event on September 10, 2025.
Authorities have not arrested a suspect; a person initially taken into custody was not involved, according to officials.
The shooting at the event hosted by Turning Point USA, co-founded by Kirk, highlighted concerns over political violence.

title: Patriots’ defensive coordinator Terrell Williams will be away from team for a few days
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots defensive coordinator Terrell Williams will be away for several days due to an unforeseen health issue.
Coach Mike Vrabel did not specify Williams's health issue but emphasized the priority of Williams's recovery.
Inside linebackers coach Zak Kuhr may fill in, but play-calling decisions for Sunday's game against the Dolphins are pending.

title: 8 unforgettable fall destinations in Vermont, according to Boston.com readers
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Franklin County's rail trails and Scenic Route 100 Byway are top fall destinations, offering biking and scenic drives.
Stowe is a popular destination for fall foliage, known as a leaf peeping utopia and near Ben & Jerryâ€™s Factory.
Lake Champlain offers cabin rentals, antique shopping, and proximity to Canada, highlighted as a preferred fall getaway.

title: Readers: Are cider doughnuts ever bad?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Boston.com invites readers to share opinions on whether cider doughnuts can be bad.
Alex Schwartz highlights ideal cider doughnuts as not too crispy, airy yet dense, and moderately glazed.
In 2023, Bolton Spring Farm, Carver Hill Orchard, and Smolak Farms were top-rated for cider doughnuts by readers.

title: Review & setlist: Dua Lipa ramps up the energy, and the electricity, at TD Garden
author: Annie Jonas and Kelly Chan
bullets: Dua Lipa performed at TD Garden on September 9, 2025, as part of her 'Radical Optimism Tour.'
Opening act CIL energized the crowd with a blend of soulful pop and dance beats before Dua Lipa's two-hour set.
Lipa covered Aerosmith's 'I Don't Want to Miss a Thing,' adding a Boston touch to her pop spectacle performance.

title: How to buy World Cup tickets for Gillette Stadium
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Gillette Stadium in Foxborough will host seven World Cup games from June 13 to July 9, 2026.
Tickets sold via three phases include a Visa Presale, Early Ticket Draw, and Random Selection.
Single-game tickets start at $60, with premium seats up to $6,730 and additional hospitality packages available.

title: Greg Olsen spoke about getting replaced by Tom Brady
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Greg Olsen was replaced by Tom Brady as Fox Sports' lead color commentator after Brady signed a 10-year deal in 2022.
Olsen expressed frustration at media portrayal, emphasizing there was no personal animosity between him and Brady.
Brady faced pressure to perform well in broadcasting, with mixed reviews following his Super Bowl commentary.

title: Boston police release photos in late-night cellphone thefts investigation
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Boston police released photos to identify suspects in cellphone thefts outside city nightclubs and bars.
The suspects allegedly stole phones during rideshares and by threatening victims, accessing sensitive personal information.
The incidents occurred in Fenway, Back Bay, Downtown, and the Seaport, mostly between 11:30 p.m. and 2 a.m.
